text:
58 yo male with HIV, PHTN, Hep C cirrhosis, OSA, DM, CHF. P/w
   increasing DOE over the past 2-3 weeks.  Per recent pulmonogy and
   cardiology notes this shortness of breath has been getting gradually
   worse. He also notes a 40 lbs weight gain that he reports over the last
   few weeks (from 330 to 360). Worsening leg edema, ascites. No recent
   fevers, no abdominal pain. C/o diarrhea x 2 days and some chills
   recently. He describes chest pain that started on the right side of his
   chest one day prior to admission.  It is pleuritic in nature and ranges
   from [**2184-3-15**].  In the ED, vitals were 97.8 89 123/64 24 96 on RA.  He
   was given an ASA. Pressure dropped to 80s, then responded to 90s after
   given some fluids (500cc NS). Held lasix (takes 160 per day?).  CXR
   with ? some effusions.  K+ 6.9, received 1 amp Ca gluconate, kayexelate
   and 325 of ASA. No ECG changes. Admit to CCU, placed on CPAP given his
   respiratory distress. Concerns are for worsening PHTN, presumed due to
   HIV and dCHF. Hyperkalemia likely related to acute RF in setting of
   increase diuresis.
